DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: VIEIRA JUNIOR, H.;Vieira, Helcio;Vieira Junior, Hlcio;Vieira, Hlcio;VIEIRA, H

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: He is a retired Colonel of the Brazilian Air Force. He earned a Bachelors in Aeronautics Science at the Brazilian Air Force Academy (1991); a Master's degree in Operations Research from the Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, RJ, Brazil (2003); and a PhD degree in Operations Research from the Technological Institute of Aeronautics, So Jos dos Campos, SP, Brazil (2011). His research interest is in the area of Design of Experiments, Simulation Optimization, Discrete-Event Simulation applied to military problems and Optics.

MESTRADO.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA JUNIOR, H.;Vieira, Helcio;Vieira Junior, Hlcio;Vieira, Hlcio;VIEIRA, H

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main purpose of this project is to test and evaluate military systems of the Brazilian Air Force in order to operate them in an optimized way.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA JUNIOR, H.;Vieira, Helcio;Vieira Junior, Hlcio;Vieira, Hlcio;VIEIRA, H

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Design of Experiments for military problems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The main purpose of this project is to study the available designs in the literature and develop new ones for specific military problems, in special, designs for binary outcomes.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: VIEIRA JUNIOR, H.;Vieira, Helcio;Vieira Junior, Hlcio;Vieira, Hlcio;VIEIRA, H

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of an all-metallic Korsch TMA telescope
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Development of an all-metallic Korsch TMA telescope
This project aims the development of an all-metallic Korsch TMA (Three Mirror Anastigmatic) telescope for optical remote sensing from space.
The main goal is to achieve sub-metric resolutions from micro-satellites (27U Cubesat).
In the first stage, a feasibility study will be done.
In the second stage, a UTMA (unobscured TMA) telescope working in LWIR spectrum that can be housed in a 12U Cubesat will be developed.
The final stage aims to develop a Korsch TMA that has sub-metric resolution in the visible spectrum at an altitude of 450 km.
The actual stage of this research to the development of an all-metallic telescope in LWIR that could be housed in a 12U cubesat with GSD of 25 meters.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Development of an all-metallic Korsch TMA telescope
